I'm not too keen on the terms of this poll. The separation of Christians into Catholic and non-catholic seems a little blunt, encompassing as it does the Eastern Orthodox churches, right through Anglicanism, Lutheranism and other moderate groups right through to the fundie evangelicals. Also I think grouping Pagan and ancient together is bizarre given that Wicca, one of the more popular strands of modern paganism, is barely 50 years old.

So would you suggest a single "christian" option or a whole bunch of them? I mean there's splits in all faiths and if you start getting really nitty gritty the results of the poll would be more difficult to interpret and the poll quite large.
I would suggest either one big Christian option or splitting it into moderate, liberal, conservative, or splitting non-catholic into liberal and conservative.

Well, I only have 10 poll options, and I can't really name each and every Christian sect, there are simply too many. 
 
 As for Wicca, many consider it an ancient religion, seeing as it's roots go back thousands of years.
None of the Wiccans I know do...

Neither do all of the Wiccans I know, but some do. That said, I only had 10 poll options, so I had to put Wiccan in the Pagan/Ancient category simply to have enough space to represent the other options.

 ah, but you're not wrong. For one who makes their own religion as they go, they are their religion. You're religion, is you are religion. In this case it's not wrong.

I would suggest either one big Christian option or splitting it into moderate, liberal, conservative, or splitting non-catholic into liberal and conservative.

 
 Doing it like that adds the shadow of politics and allows cliche tags like "fundamentalist," "progressive," etc. to be slapped on people. Religion does have a real world side to it, but at its core, it's individually spiritual and shouldn't be spread out along a spectrum like politics or temperature readings. Then again, that just my opinion.

I'm intrested in what the religious makeup of the forums are. Now, I have a feeling that it is predominantly made up of the differing Protestant sects, but then, I could be horribly off.

 
 There's a whole lot of diversity on this forum, but in my case, I'm afraid your predictions were correct: I'm Southern Baptist. However, unlike some of my gang, I don't push my views onto people. Sure, I'd like to bring more folks into the Christian and/or Baptist faith, but I don't press the issue. So, hats off to whatever you believe.
Atheism and agnosticism are not religions you understand, correct?

True, but they are belief systems, and many people, when asked what their religion is answer that they are atheist or agnostic, so that is why it is not only an option on many official surveys and documents, it is an option here.
Christian with many questions who refuses to belong to any specific church or give up common sense or rule out history and science.

Well, I only have 10 poll options, and I can't really name each and every Christian sect, there are simply too many. 
 
 As for Wicca, many consider it an ancient religion, seeing as it's roots go back thousands of years.

 
 I went to Purdue University, and on one form that they ask you to fill out there was an optional section for relgion. It offered 90 different Christian sects, 3 Jewish, Muslim, Eastern (buddhish, taoist, etc) and athiest. I found it fascination that they cared if you were a reformed or unreformed Baptist, but made no distinction between Taoist and Buddhist. I don't think Wiccan made the list at all. All in all I think you did an ok job given that you could only list 10 options.

Thankyou very much. :)
